Header: Efforts made to control floods in Matara
Content: The Irrigation Department has launched a programme to control the floods that are impacting the Matara area. Accordingly an effort is being made to clean the Kiramba-Aara River which is a tertiary of the Nilwala River. Accordingly, eight kilometres from Pattare to Palolpitiya is being developed. The allocation made for this effort is two million rupees. This programme will enable to control floods that occur in several areas including Palolpitiya, Polathugoda, Vitiyala, Akurugoda and Talwatte. The Irrigation Department said that the programme which is in the final phase will be of great relief for the people as well as farming activities.
